text:
When running Ant from cygwin, the antlr task is unable to find the ANTLR jar 
file. I get the following error message:

[antlr] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: antlr/Tool

However, the antlr task works fine if I run Ant from the MSDOS prompt.

text:
I tried running the latest nightly build of Ant. Now the antlr task fails both 
when running in MSDOS shell and when running in cygwin bash shell. Error 
message is as follows:

Could not create task or type of type: antlr.
Ant could not find the task or a class this
task relies upon.
Common solutions are to use taskdef to declare
your task, or, if this is an optional task,
to put the optional.jar and all required libraries of
this task in the lib directory of
your ant installation (ANT_HOME).

I tried both putting the ANTLR jar in Ant's lib directory and using the 
<classpath> nested element for the antlr task.

I don't get it.
There is absolutely no reference to an antlr class in the Antlr task so the 
only way to have the error you have is to forget to put the correct 
optional.jar in ant lib.

Also little reminder about building Ant. It requires *a lot* of 'optional' 
packages to build correctly the optional.jar. If you don't pay attention you 
are likely to generate an optional.jar that includes only 10% of the optional 
tasks. As there is no antlr import this is unlikely to happen though.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
sbailliez@apache.org

believe there is no problem here and it was a duplicate of 4899.
